name: Ronen Shaltiel
content: Ronen Shaltiel Ronen Shaltiel (in hebrew: רונן שאלתיאל) Professor, Department of Computer Science. University of Haifa. Office Amir 411 (Campus Hanamal) Snail mail Department of Computer Science, University of Haifa, 31905, Israel. phone +972-4-8249952 fax +972-4-8249331 Email ronen at cs dot haifa dot ac dot il Online papers Research papers. My Thesis and Surveys. Research Interests Complexity theory. Pseudorandomness and derandomization. Explicit constructions of combinatorial objects. Cryptography. Some Professional Activities Publicity Chair: The International Conference on Randomization and Computation (RANDOM). Registration Chair: Computational Complexity Conference (2018-2021). Program Committee member:  20th International Workshop on Randomization and Computation (RANDOM 2016). Associate Editor: Transactions on Computation Theory (ToCT). Invited Speaker: The 38th International Colloquium on Automata, Languages and Programming (ICALP 2011). Chair of Program Committee: 14th International Workshop on Randomization and Computation (RANDOM 2010). Member of ECCC scientific board. Conference Committee: IEEE Conference on Computational Complexity (2008-2011). Program Committee member: 11th International Workshop on Randomization and Computation (RANDOM 2007). Program Committee member: 22nd IEEE Conference on Computational Complexity (CCC 2007). Program Committee member:  4th Theory of Cryptography Conference (TCC 2007). Teaching Foundations of Cryptography (Spring 2018). Seminar in Theory of Computer Science (Spring 2018). Computational Complexity (Spring 2017). Topics in Pseudorandomness (Fall 2016). Computational Complexity (Spring 2015). Introduction to Coding Theory (Fall 2014-2015) Computational Complexity (Spring 2013). Foundations of Cryptography (Spring 2012). Computational Complexity (Fall 2010-2011). Foundations of Cryptography (Spring 2010). Computational Complexity (Spring 2009). Theory Seminar (Fall 2006-2007, Spring 2007, Fall 2007-2008, Spring 2008), Foundations of Cryptography (Spring 2008). Computational Complexity (Spring 2007). Computational Models (Spring 2005, Fall 2005-2006, Spring 2006, Fall 2006-2007, Fall 2007-2008, Spring 2008, Fall 2008-2009, Spring 2009). Introduction to Coding Theory (Fall 2006-2007). Topics in Pseudorandomness (Fall 2005-2006). Probabilistic Algorithms (Fall 2004-2005). Topics in Pseudorandomness (Together with Omer Reingold at the Weizmann Institute, 2003). Extractors and Pseudorandom generators (at the Weizmann Institute, 2001). Previous Education and Positions Postdoc at the Weizmann Institute of science (2001-2004) under Oded Goldreich and Moni Naor. A visiting student at the Theoretical Computer Science and Discrete Mathematics program, Institute For advanced Study, Princeton, NJ (1999-2001). Ph.D. Student (1996-2001) Advisor: Prof. Avi Wigderson. Hebrew University, Jerusalem.
